comments.author: sirius_twe@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 BTRS69229 Firefox/3.6.13
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 BTRS69229 Firefox/3.6.13

I set my resolution to native (1920*1080).
dpi scaling to 200%.
1st problem:
Since then firefox can't handle dragging function properly.
Please set your resolution and dpi as above and open four tab.
then try to drag first tab to the end.

2nd problem:
can't drag favicon to the bookmarks menu properly. Please put new folder and add some sites in it.
Then try to drag a site's favicon into the the folder. the indicator line appears at slightly different position.

these 2 seems windows dpi related problem

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.use windows 7
2.set resolution to native
3.set dpi to 200%
4.launch firefox and open four tabs.
5.try to drag first tab to the end of the tab bar (after fourth bar).
6.2nd problem: try to drag favicon into the bookmark menu's any folder.
7.3rd problem: screen resolution by http://browserspy.dk/ says wrong.
Actual Results:  
1st problem: the tab dragging results in wrong tab positioning.
2nd problem: the indicator line which indicates current position is wrong.
3rd problem: almost always horizontal scroll bar appears. the above site and many other sites displays incorrectly. 

Expected Results:  
1st: correct position in tab dragging.
2nd: correct indicator line at the dragging favicon.
3rd: correct resolution.

not available.

comments.text: We have many, many bugs in our system and it sometimes takes a long time to triage them. Resetting summary and moving back to better component.

comments.raw_text: Robert, Timothy, this seems like your kind of thing.

comments.text: I tried dragging tabs and changing their order and dragging them to the bookmarks menu on Windows XP with 200% DPI with Firefox 6 and I couldn't see any problems. The original report is from Firefox 3.6. Does this happen with Firefox 4 or newer?
comments.raw_text: I tried dragging tabs and changing their order and dragging them to the bookmarks menu on Windows XP with 200% DPI with Firefox 6 and I couldn't see any problems. The original report is from Firefox 3.6. Does this happen with Firefox 4 or newer?
comments.author: tnikkel@gmail.com
edwardsgreg@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: I suspect the work in Bug 820679 and Bug 844604 has fixed all of these issues if they weren't already fixed.
